title: A Syrian Kurdish Undercover Agent Stole Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's Underwear For DNA Testing
text:
Islamic State Of Iraq and the Levant (ISIS or ISIL) leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, was reportedly killed in a US military raid in Northwest Syria, the US President Donald Trump said. During a press conference, Trump confirmed that he was killed and that “Baghdadi was kept under surveillance for a couple of weeks."

In order to confirm the identity of the ISIL leader, a Syrian Kurd undercover agent took a pair of his underwear - basically stole it - for DNA testing before his death, a Kurdish official told AFP. Polat Can, a senior adviser to the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) took to Twitter to provide details of his death.

AFP

“Since 15 May, we have been working together with the CIA to track al-Baghdadi and monitor him closely. Al-Baghdadi changed his places of residence very often,” Polat Can told AFP, adding that the asset managed to reach the house where the ISIS chief was believed to be hiding.

‘Our own source, who had been able to reach al-Baghdadi, brought al-Baghdadi's underwear to conduct a DNA test and make sure (100%) that the person in question was al-Baghdadi himself', the adviser wrote on Twitter.

He also confirmed that Baghdadi was killed in the US military raid in the northwestern province of Idlib and it was largely the result of intelligence work. "Our intelligence source was involved in sending coordinates, directing the airdrop, participating in and making the operation a success until the last minute," Polat Can said.

If reports are to be believed, after Baghdadi, the new ISIL leader - Abdullah Qardash - is a former officer of Saddam Hussein. He was already running kill campaigns for the terror group and has formally taken over the charge after Baghdadi was killed on Saturday.
